windows 10 环境进入游戏发现鼠标转动视角时乱闪解决方法（本人测试有效）：
选项 --> 鼠标 --> Raw mouse input (原始鼠标输入) 勾选后试试。

When you enter the game and find the Angle of view of mouse rotation, the solution will flash randomly (it is effective in my test) :
Option -> mouse -> Raw mouse input ，check it ,try move ur mouse this 'bug' might be solved.

Не знаю, как так вышло, но в в дополнении "Blew Shit")) не было такого большого кол-ва багов. Я умудрялся несколько раз застрять в тупой лестнице. Отбросив техническую часть этой игры, можно сказать, что эта игра хороша. Новые оружия, монстры, их такое кол-во, что, кажется, игра была создана специально для мочилова с монстрами. Такой экшон. Жесть. Однако, с сюжетной части игра приуспела. Half Life - это именно та игра, в которой историю тебе показывают со всех сторон, от лица главного героя, противника и второстепенного незначимого персонажа. Так вот, в этом дополении игра происходит от лица врага, который вечно пытался убить фримена, и всех тех, кто встанет на его пути. 
Так же рекомендую к прохождению.
MAN it sure sucks to be a HECU!

Good

Half Life: Opposing Force was a really really good story addon to Half Life. In this one, instead of playing as Gordon Freeman, you play as the military. You play as Corporal Shepard. This also introduces a new race of aliens called Race X. I have to admit, this one was more a challenge than the original Half Life. It also introduced new guns and weapons. Overall, I would absolutely recommend this.

Opposing Force, surprisingly enough, surpasses the original Half-Life in certain ways. One being combat, I thought the FPS mechanics in this game were more exciting. I suppose you do play as a military soldier after all. My favorite part though was the horror aspects, Opposing Force, even though it's more action packed, was quite a bit scarier. I loved the lack of lighting in a lot of spots, making you resort to night vision to see in pitch black darkness, it reminded me a lot of the Outlast games in that regard. I think the game I'd compare it most to would be F.E.A.R., which is an absolute master in the ways of horror and first-person shooting. 

Overall this is a solid expansion to Half-Life, and if you enjoyed the original game, then I'm sure you'd enjoy this one.

So after finishing Half-Life I decided, "Well why not learn the rest of the story and play the add-ons", so I installed Opposing Force & Blue Shift. Opposing Force is something completely fresh from the boot camp till the end. I'll say there is a majority of this that I actually preferred more than the main game, from the squad building to the new weapons. In this add-on you get to experience the story of Colonel Shepard, a soldier who just refuses to die apparently. This experience also shows Black Mesa after Freeman enters Xen and builds on the marines, showing the true reality behind their mission. This add-on also builds on the physics and momentum mechanics, which would be what the source engine was built on. 9/10 This game was a bitch to finish lemme tell you that.
Awesome expansion for the OG Half-Life. Nice variety of weapons and the enemies are interesting,

Good expansion, finished it at around 3 hours. Telling you the story of black mesa incident from the perspective of HECU grunt. Shorter than hl1, but harder. Mostly challenging, but there are some difficulty spikes here and there. More weapons as well, tho many of them felt redundant and too conditional. There's a squad mechanic, but it's too basic and used mostly on story segment. I only use the medic guy once, and although they are quite useful against the black ops as a distraction, they're useless against the alien. Overall, it's still a good game and recommended.
